job_title: Mental Health Technician in Horsham, PA
pros:
it's a job that pays money.

some co workers are cool.
cons:
This hospital is completely ineffective at protecting it's staff. Patients in some units are allowed to be admitted without a covid test. Employees were going to be required to be vaccinated (but they reversed course on that).

Irresponsible employees frequently show up to work to infect the patient population and face no consequences and aren't event given the opportunity to quarantine.

There are no vaccination requirements for the employees or patients. This place is a wonderful cesspool of malaise and politics that is going to get someone killed. Some of the employees are immunocompromised and walk around scared to death because the company they work for aren't putting any kind of priority on their health and safety.

The so called CEO removed plexiglass shields from the nurses station that pre-date covid. The reason is that that didn't make the place feel inviting.

This woman has no idea what she's doing and should not be running any kind of healthcare organization. We all carry burdens, but morbidy overweight people should not be in charge of healthcare. She is completely at fault for not protecting the hospital patients and staff. OSHA and covid protocools allow for her to protect everyone, but she has make the choice to not do so. I hope she is liable for something.

In conclusion, don't work here.

pros: Benefits offered and a consistent paycheck;
cons: Lack of support and supervision

review_title: Not bad place to work. Just need better management and more staff

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Ambler, PA
pros: Have made a lot of new friends here. Really like some of the people I work with. Great benefits.
cons: Poor management very disorganized. Frequently short staffed. Very stressful environment to work in. No one is ever disciplined for their bad behavior making it very difficult for those employees who do their job right.

review_title: They do the best they can, they are a lot better than most of the psych hospitals in the SE PA area
job_title: Mental Health Technician in Horsham, PA
pros:
80% of my coworkers were the best people I ever met. Most of them were very dedicated to the field and had my back in many challenging situations.
I found the job to be extremely rewarding on a personal level. I felt enlightened by the many unique situations I was put while working with the patients, even the extremely difficult ones.
It offered me an opportunity to work with a diverse population of psychiatric patients, ranging greatly in age and severity of illnesses. 
While working as an EMT I visited all of the major psych hospitals in the south east PA area, this one has by far the best staff and seems the least detrimental to the patients well being (not to imply Horsham is a godsend...).
Horsham is by no means a hell hole, I witnessed many positive interactions between patients and staff and I am happy I spent almost a year working there. In the end I left because I was sick of seeing patients suffer from this under-funded and under-staffed struggling hospital.
cons:
Everything comes down to lack of funding. I would say 70% of all the shifts I worked were understaffed. This can cause serious threats to ones safety if you are working on units with aggressive patients. Lack of staffing leads to many patients needs being unmet, and their mental health either staying static or further worsening. The only patients who have a chance of seeing improvement are the ones who are already relatively under control mentally or have means of stability in their personal lives; those who are low functioning seem to be stuck in a cycle of going back and forth from the hospital and their broken lives, from my perspective. This is not to say the cycle is completely Horshams fault, however the therapeutic treatment they provide often seems so limited that some patients seem bound to return or have trouble reaching a point they seem fit to leave. 
There is barely anything for the patients to do on the units. It was heartbreaking to watch patients deteriorate after sometimes months of under-stimulation. There is little to no scheduled activity besides "groups" which are run by the social workers. These groups function like community meetings for the patients, which are valuable but only last for about an hour. Its up to the nurses and techs to entertain the patients for the remainder of the day, which is difficult considering all the shifts are already understaffed! 
Medication is the substitute for real therapeutic counseling, working as a tech or nurse means you will have to reinforce this pharmaceutical philosophy using force. What many of the patients need is extensive and focused therapy with a counselor, but instead get TV, bored games, and walls to stare at while doped up on 10mg of Ativan. 
The pay is also very low for techs considering how dangerous the job can be at times.
They constantly barrage you on your time off with calls and text messages about picking up extra shifts. While they do offer generous compensation for these bonus hours, the amount texts they send is absurd and shows how desperate they are to keep their hospital afloat.

review_title: Find a better place to work.
job_title: Mental Health Technician in Ambler, PA
pros: Offered benefits and bonuses occasionally. There were a lot of extra hours if you wanted them. It's a good feeling to help people.
cons: You're going to be overworked and you won't make decent money unless you're doing constant doubles. The units are almost always understaffed. There were multiple occasions where I was the only tech on the unit which can be extremely unsafe. Some patients can be aggressive which would be fine if your unit is fully staffed. There were clearly favorites who got extra benefits.

pros: pay, free meals, shifts always avaiable.
cons: no support, move you around, unsafe.

review_title: Not a wonderful place to work

review_title: Not a career, just a job
pros: There are no real good reasons at this time
cons: Horsham has been one of the worst places that I have worked for thus far. The admissions department is a joke. The department is unstructured, not very clean. The staff are very unprofessional, rude. I am disappointed by the overall culture of the department and company. I thought that the people were there to help you, but in truth the really do not want to. I feel like I am in a high school setting. The department is not very supportive.  It is a bunch of fully grown people that spend most of their time gossiping and speaking negatively about current and fellow staff. I am not learning very much this time because no one wants to help you. The staff is impatient and profoundly dismissive. I so not recommend coming here if you want to work for a toxic , negative free environment.  No one is to be trusted. This place is a big disappointment.

review_title: Awesome coworkers, little room for growth
job_title: Mental Health Tech in Ambler, PA
pros: Great experience, the staff are some of the best people you'll ever meet and they really care about the patients. You'll rarely have a boring shift.
cons: If you're per diem they can move you to a different unit if one is short staffed; upper management seems out of touch with their staff on the units and they're a pretty tight knit group; the pay isn't that great

pros: The patients. I love psych, and adolescent psych. My unit was brand new and I enjoyed coming to work. I also liked most of my coworkers. They give out overtime like candy.
cons: Management. It is poorly managed, and staff is NOT SUPPORTED at all. They frequently fire people for one small offense. Very high turnover. Also salaries were not awe inspiring. They do not back up their employees involved patient altercations, which happen frequently as this is a psych hospital.

pros: Good pay, unlimited OT, good staff. Provides good experience for psych especially if it’s your first time working in mental health.
cons: Doctors are careless, administration doesn’t care for actual patient safety and quality and disregards all staff concerns. Doctors & supervisors prefer medication injections over talking with patients.

review_title: Good place to work but turnover is like the field, it can be high.
